revised_title: Characteristics of the Second Inward Current in Rat Ventricular Muscle Cells
tldr: The study investigates the second inward current (Isi) in single cells isolated from rat ventricular muscle under voltage-clamp conditions. The major ion carrying this current is calcium, and the peak amplitude of Isi is larger and the kinetics more rapid than previous studies in multicellular cardiac preparations. The results support the hypothesis that Isi is activated by depolarization and that calcium is the major charge carrier for this current.
